content.en: Defect detection revolution: Researchers have been investigating the use of various algorithms, such as support vector machines and AdaBoost classifiers, to improve the accuracy and efficiency of defect detection and classification in different materials and industries. These algorithms are combined with techniques like wavelet transform, rough set theory, and multivariate statistical analysis to enhance automated inspection processes. By leveraging the power of machine learning and computer vision, these methods aim to accurately identify and classify surface defects, corrosion grades, and even subsurface defects in metallic components.
content.da: Defektdetektionsrevolution: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af forskellige algoritmer, såsom supportvektormaskiner og AdaBoost-klassifikatorer, for at forbedre nøjagtigheden og effektiviteten af defektdetektion og klassifikation i forskellige materialer og industrier. Disse algoritmer kombineres med teknikker som wavelet-transform, rough set-teori og multivariat statistisk analyse for at forbedre automatiserede inspektionsprocesser. Ved at udnytte kraften i maskinlæring og computersyn, sigter disse metoder mod præcist at identificere og klassificere overfladefejl, korrosionsgrader og endda under overflade defekter i metalliske komponenter.
